name: Italian Meat and Spinach Pie
description: This flavor-packed lasagna-without-noodles pie is the ultimate comfort food. A friend shared this recipe with me years ago and it has become a family favorite. Perfect served with a tossed salad and glass of wine.
recipeIngredient: 1 recipe pastry for a 9-inch pie crust
½ pound mild or hot turkey Italian sausage, casings removed
¾ cup chopped red bell pepper
1 (10 ounce) package frozen chopped spinach, thawed and well drained
1 ½ cups shredded mozzarella cheese, divided
1 (6 ounce) can sliced black olives, drained

recipeInstructions.text: Line a 9-inch pie pan with the pastry and press the edges of the crust with a fork to seal it to the pie dish. Cover loosely with plastic wrap and refrigerate while you prepare the sauce.

Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat and stir in the ground beef, turkey sausage, and 1 clove of minced garlic. Cook and stir until the meat is crumbly, evenly browned, and no longer pink. Drain and discard any excess grease. Add the onion, red bell pepper, and mushrooms and cook, stirring frequently, until the onion is soft and translucent and the mushrooms have given off their liquid, about 5 minutes. Add the remaining garlic and cook for 30 seconds.
Stir in the tomato paste, water, salt, basil, and oregano and bring the sauce to a boil. Reduce the heat to low, cover, and simmer for 10 minutes. Remove from heat and set aside.
Preheat an oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C).

Line the chilled pie crust with a double thickness of aluminum foil. Bake for 9 minutes. Remove the foil and continue baking until the bottom of the crust is set, about 7 more minutes (see Editor's Note for tips). Remove from the oven and set aside. Reduce the oven temperature to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).

Combine the spinach, ricotta, and 1/2 cup mozzarella cheese. Spoon the filling into the baked crust. Top with the meat mixture. Cover the edges of the pie crust with foil to prevent over-browning, place the pie on a baking sheet, and bake for 45 minutes.

Remove the pie from the oven. Top the meat mixture with 1 cup of mozzarella cheese, chopped tomatoes, and sliced olives. Return it to the oven and bake until the cheese is melted, about 10 minutes. Let stand for 10 minutes before serving.

review.reviewBody: Loved Loved Loved this!!! Definately skip the salt you won't miss it. Also I added more veggies zucchini carrotts. I doubled the tomatoe sauce and doubled the recipe and doubled the seasonings. Absolutely 2 thumbs up.

I originally submitted this recipe using ground turkey and turkey sausage.  Brown in 1 T olive oil, with 1 T garlic, basil and oregano, you really have to season the meat while cooking. Also, I do not use any salt in my recipe, I don't feel it's needed.

I made this for dinner tonight and this was a hit! Fantastic blend of flavors and very moist loved the combination of pie crust spinach and meat. I doubled the recipe and used 2 pie crusts in a 9x13 glass dish. Served to 6 adults at a casual weekend dinner and not a morsel was left over. I will definately add this to my regular rotation. Thanks for sharing this great recipe!

Delicious! (so say husband kids and adult friend) I doubled the recipe. No mushrooms or olives (I'm the only one who likes them) and no peppers (I hate them) but substituted zucchini in with the meat and tomato sauce. Pretty much followed everything else. It was good--but I'll probably stick with regular lasagna. Fun to make a change though!
We loved this hearty recipe. It reminded us of a meatlovers deep dish pizza.
Easy fast and healthy dinner. Definitely a keeper.

More garlic triple the tomato paste and way more seasonings in general. Besides that though this is really really good and one of my husband's favorite recipes. I always forget to thaw the frozen spinach I use BEFORE cooking the meat which would save time for me.

I have made this twice now and both times ended up with only 1 serving for leftovers.  I rarely have ricotta in the house so used Greek yogurt instead.  I have also made it once with fresh spinach and once with frozen.  If using fresh then chop it very finely and double the quantity called for and it will cook down to the same amount.  I also made a mistake the last time and opened a can of plum tomatoes before realizing I was supposed to use tomato paste instead.  So I blended the tomatoes up with my hand blender, added the spices as directed and then added 2 Tbs of Bulgar wheat to the meat and tomato sauce, cooked an additional 15 min and it came out great.   Rave reviews from all in the house including the picky 5 yr old.

Will be adding this to my regular monthly rotation.

The blend of flavors is wonderful. I made my own crust so I'm not sure it is worth all that effort but it is good. I absolutely will use this combination of meat sauce cheese and spinach the next time I make calzones. Thank you Office Prisoner!

Sorry but I thought this was VERY bland. And a lot of work to go through for this pie. Made it exactly (except for mushrooms)the way it was written. I could not fit all the spinach mixture nor all the beef mixture in the pie either.
